definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: What we're talking about is why it's so hard to pull off well.
sentences.chinese: 我們所談論的正是難以割捨這根網線的原因。

sentences.english: We must chuck them… in this shit life.
sentences.chinese: 我們一定要學會割捨，因爲人生的路坎坷。

sentences.english: Readers of all ages retain a remarkable emotional attachment to the thing.
sentences.chinese: 各個年齡段的讀者難以割捨對紙質圖書的這份依戀。

sentences.english: Yet he has also conceded, privately, that it would be a huge wrench to leave Stamford Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 但是特里私下承認斯坦福橋讓他難以割捨。

sentences.english: She appeared to have let go of most earthly ties.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎已割捨了與人間的大多數血脈親情。

definition: to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to worry about/to be concerned about
in the end/after all is said and done
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
